text: From as far as I can remember, I have always been drawn to the art of codecasting.
Enchanted words inscribed upon scrolls, weaving the fabric of our daily lives.
Growing up in the village of Codehaven, I would often find myself in the vicinity of the codecasters, quietly observing them at work.
From the mundane task of tallying pastries fresh from the oven to creating a self-sustaining farm, the possibilites of codecasting seemed to know no bounds.
On a particular day, however, a voice suddenly appeared behind me, starling me from my usual observation.
"Watching the codecasters at work again, are you?"
I turned to find the esteemed codecaster Mundur, his gaze warm and welcoming.
"I can see your keen fascination for codecasting."
His words lingered in the silence between us.
"The path of codecasting offers more than meets the eye. Are you willing to do more than simply observe?"
Though nervous, I nodded eagerly, my heart racing at the possibility of becoming a codecaster.
A gentle smile graced his face.
From the folds of his robe, he retrieved a thick leatherbound tome.
"Within these pages lies the knowledge of codecasting."
"Study it well, for the road ahead will be filled with challenges, but also opportunities for growth."
From the moment the tome settled into my trembling hands, {SPEED=0.3}I knew...
This marked the beginning of my codecasting {SPEED=0.3}odyssey...
And so, I visited him the next day for my very first lesson of codecasting.
